title: Group Learning Project Design for Hybrid Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical operation skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
context.additional_context: Utilization of smartphone-based collaboration tools (instant messengers, Google Docs). Two 90-minute face-to-face sessions per week + asynchronous assignments

learning_goals: Learners can collaborate within groups to design mathematical approaches for solving real-life problems (e.g., budget planning, measurement).
Learners can identify and correct at least two errors discovered during the problem-solving process through communication with team members.

Based on project deliverables, learners create a 5-minute oral presentation and A3-sized poster or under-3-minute video visuals, achieving an average of 4+ points per item (9+/12 total) on a peer evaluation rubric (3 items: content delivery, creativity, visual impact, 5-point scale). This goal is assessed in the final project presentation at the 6-month course conclusion, with two interim feedback opportunities (at 3rd and 5th months) for improvement

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
